xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 01 May 2013
xwikidoc.content: <khodeir> has joined #ccm 03:29 <sdumitriu> has joined #ccm 03:51 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 09:43 <roque> has joined #ccm 09:57 <krinye> has joined #ccm 09:57 <krinye> Hello any mentors around 10:01 <sdumitriu> Hi krinye 10:02 <sdumitriu> Read your messages on Melange 10:02 <sdumitriu> Have a little patience 10:10 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 10:31 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 11:05 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 11:06 <BogdanVancea> has joined #ccm 11:08 <sdumitriu1> Hey, lots of people today 11:08 <sdumitriu1> Let's see, does anybody want to fix an easy issue? https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/issues?labels=easy 12:18 <kushalk124> has joined #ccm 12:31 <khodeir> has joined #ccm 12:38 <khodeir> has joined #ccm 12:50 <froggy> has joined #ccm 13:10 <BogdanVancea> sdumitriu, how does the contributing work for phenotips? 13:11 <BogdanVancea> can I just issue a pull request with my fix? 13:11 <sdumitriu1> BogdanVancea: Yes 13:11 <sdumitriu1> What issue? 13:11 <BogdanVancea> https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/issues/432 13:13 <sdumitriu1> Cool 13:13 <sdumitriu1> Yes, a Pull Request is the best way 13:13 <BogdanVancea> Okay 13:13 <sdumitriu1> Are you familiar with GitHub? 13:13 <BogdanVancea> I'll test it for a while 13:14 <BogdanVancea> and the issue a pull request 13:14 <BogdanVancea> a bit familiar 13:14 <BogdanVancea> I forked the repo 13:14 <BogdanVancea> and will push the changes, then issue the pull request 13:14 <BogdanVancea> that's the model, right? 13:16 <sdumitriu1> Yes 13:16 <sdumitriu1> Keep in mind that commits for pull requests should go in a dedicated branch 13:16 <sdumitriu1> One branch per issue 13:17 <sdumitriu1> Otherwise if you're trying to do more than one pull request from the same branch it won't work 13:20 <BogdanVancea> I see 13:20 <BogdanVancea> thank you 13:21 <sdumitriu1> What project are you applying for? 13:21 <BogdanVancea> the Solr backend for MedSavant 13:21 <BogdanVancea> but since there are no issues there 13:21 <BogdanVancea> and I was a little bored 13:21 <BogdanVancea> I thought I'd give this one a try 13:24 <BogdanVancea> It would seem I'm not quite done on the fix for #432, my version only displays the first OMIM disease :) 13:24 <sdumitriu1> But that's a good start :) 13:25 <BogdanVancea> yeah, I'll keep working on it :) 13:25 <sdumitriu1> Did you manage to run MedSavant? 13:27 <BogdanVancea> yes, I have 13:28 <BogdanVancea> I got it to launch the login panel 13:28 <BogdanVancea> but it displayed no buttons, just 2 inputs 13:29 <sdumitriu1> Hm.. 13:29 <sdumitriu1> That sounds like a bug 13:30 <BogdanVancea> well, I remember I changed some code 13:30 <BogdanVancea> to get it to run 13:30 <BogdanVancea> but it was just hardcoding some properties 13:30 <BogdanVancea> I was running it on linux 13:48 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 13:55 <froggy> has joined #ccm 13:55 <lacir> has joined #ccm 14:04 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 14:24 <sdumitriu1> BogdanVancea: Looks perfect, merged! 14:24 <BogdanVancea> yay 14:24 <BogdanVancea> :) 14:25 <BogdanVancea> This was my first fix for an open source project and my first pull request. It feels really nice :) 14:25 <sdumitriu1> Are you on twitter? 14:25 <BogdanVancea> yes 14:26 <BogdanVancea> @BogdanVancea 14:33 <sdumitriu1> So, did you prepare the application? 14:33 <sdumitriu1> Don't delay, submit today! 14:36 <lacir> has left #ccm 14:36 <BogdanVancea> has joined #ccm 15:10 <BogdanVancea> sdumitriu, regarding the MedSavant issue I told you about earlier, it turned out to be an error on my side, I wasn't running with the porper java version. 15:10 <BogdanVancea> So, there's no bug :) 15:11 <sdumitriu1> Ah, good to know 15:11 <sdumitriu1> Which version was that? 15:12 <BogdanVancea> I have java 1.8 installed and I had to set the JDK for the MedSavant client to JDK 1.7 to get it to run 15:13 <sdumitriu1> 8 already? 15:13 <sdumitriu1> Anyway, that's still a bug 15:13 <BogdanVancea> Ubuntu software updated asked, I wasn;t paying attention 15:13 <BogdanVancea> so it installed 15:15 <BogdanVancea> And it seems the MedSavantServerEngine only runs on 1.6 15:15 <BogdanVancea> gives compile error on 1.7 15:16 <sdumitriu1> Yes, I think there's a problem with a JDBC connector interface 15:16 <sdumitriu1> They keep adding methods to it, and so the classes that implement that interface must also add those methods 15:16 <sdumitriu1> Hm, this is an idea for a pull request for you 15:16 <sdumitriu1> Fix the compilation errors 15:16 <BogdanVancea> and allow it to run on 1.7? 15:16 <BogdanVancea> cool 15:17 <BogdanVancea> I'll get on it 15:17 <BogdanVancea> :) 15:36 <roque> has joined #ccm 15:53 <BogdanVancea> sdumitriu1, is MedSavant supposed to not download the GeneMania data when creating a new project? 15:54 <sdumitriu1> Hm, I have no idea 15:55 <sdumitriu1> I've had little experience with MedSavant, Marc is the main developer 15:55 <BogdanVancea> I see 15:55 <sdumitriu1> I'm just mentoring the Solr part of the project 15:56 <BogdanVancea> I understand :) 16:01 <khodeir> has joined #ccm 16:07 <roque> has joined #ccm 16:19 <sdumitriu1> BogdanVancea: Looks good, I'll let Marc merge it 16:19 <BogdanVancea> Okay :) 16:20 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 16:21 <vshivam> sdumitriu: Hi ! 16:21 <sdumitriu1> Hi vshivam 16:22 <vshivam> Hey ! I was submitting a proposal for the development of an Android Application for chronic disease management 16:22 <vshivam> I tried contacting Marc through email. I suppose he's been pretty busy 16:22 <sdumitriu1> Yes 16:23 <vshivam> There are a lot of open ends in the project 16:23 <sdumitriu1> You should write to ccm-mentors, not to Marc personally 16:23 <vshivam> I had. 16:24 <vshivam> I wanted to know about the disease we'll be developing the application for 16:24 <vshivam> or any other ideas. 16:24 <sdumitriu1> You're supposed to pick one 16:25 <sdumitriu1> How about asthma? 16:25 <sdumitriu1> Not sure if it's a good idea... 16:25 <sdumitriu1> I shouldn't step on Marc's projects 16:26 <vshivam> neither am I about any particular disease. 16:26 <sdumitriu1> Well, do you have any ideas? 16:27 <vshivam> I read a few research papers 16:28 <vshivam> also, I was thinking if we could come up with an application about managing cigarette consumption 16:29 <khodeir> has joined #ccm 16:29 <vshivam> or for monitoring Cholestrol levels 16:30 <vshivam> and if we are able to integrate the application with a device used for monitoring Blood pressure levels 16:33 <vshivam> and monitor blood pressure levels for heart patients 16:33 <vshivam> it can be a good idea. 16:34 <vshivam> but I am not really sure about the feasibility of these ideas. 16:36 <vshivam> sdumitriu: ? 16:36 <sdumitriu1> To me they sound good 16:37 <vshivam> Is there a way I can discuss this with him ? 16:39 <sdumitriu1> You should send a follow-up email 16:39 <sdumitriu1> I'll ping him tomorrow as well 16:39 <vshivam> okay, will do. 16:41 <sdumitriu1> Oh, you're waiting for a reply since the 18th... 16:41 <vshivam> yeah. sort of. 19th I had sent the last email. 16:42 <vshivam> I came to the irc a few days ago but marta said he was busy. 17:00 <BogdanVancea> sdumitru, do you have some time to answer some questions regarding MedSavant and Solr? 17:01 <sdumitriu1> I can try 17:01 <sdumitriu1> Today is not a good day for science, it seems 17:01 <BogdanVancea> oh ;)) 17:02 <BogdanVancea> Why did you choose Solr as an alternative to ICE? 17:03 <khodeir> has joined #ccm 17:03 <BogdanVancea> and if you're busy with something, it's ok, I'll come back tomorrow :) 17:03 <sdumitriu1> As it's said in the project description, ICE is not a very good choice for speed 17:04 <sdumitriu1> It's good for size, since it compresses data very well 17:04 <sdumitriu1> As to why Solr, we've had a good experience with it in PhenoTips, and before that we've been very happy with Lucene in other projects 17:04 <BogdanVancea> I see :) 17:05 <sdumitriu1> And if it can handle Wikipedia, it sure can handle a few genomes as well 17:05 <BogdanVancea> I've used Solr for my Bachelor project, its awesome :) 17:05 <BogdanVancea> Does Phenotips rely solely on Solr for persistence? 17:06 <sdumitriu1> No 17:06 <sdumitriu1> Just for indexing ontologies 17:07 <sdumitriu1> It uses Hibernate over a RDBMS for the main storage 17:07 <BogdanVancea> ah, I see 17:08 <BogdanVancea> from what you've written in the project description for MedSavant, it sounded like you're considering using just Solr for persistence 17:11 <sdumitriu1> Yes 17:11 <sdumitriu1> Well, not only 17:11 <sdumitriu1> Making a pluggable storage interface 17:12 <sdumitriu1> So that we can switch between Solr, ICE or whatever we might implement 17:12 <BogdanVancea> ah, I undestand 17:13 <BogdanVancea> it sounds interesting :D 17:13 <BogdanVancea> thanks for the answers 17:13 <BogdanVancea> I'll head to sleep, it's past midnight in Romania 17:13 <BogdanVancea> have a nice day 17:14 <sdumitriu1> Good night 17:14 <BogdanVancea> thanks 17:14 <BogdanVancea> bye! 17:15 <khodeir> has joined #ccm 17:21 <khodeir> has joined #ccm 17:43 <khodeir> has joined #ccm 17:59 <khodeir> has joined #ccm 18:18 <khodeir> has joined #ccm 20:33 <roque> has joined #ccm 21:38 <kushalkhandelwal> sdumitriu: 21:38 <kushalkhandelwal> Hey 21:58 <sdumitriu> has joined #ccm 22:32 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 23:14 <khodeir> has joined #ccm
